Why don't the cattle ranchers dairy farmers test?

Testing the raw milk is a no-brainer. Since pasteurization kills the virus, non-pharmaceutical interventions should be effective without the need for culling. The trick is to keep outbreaks contained to the farm. Testing and "quarantining" farmers makes sense once an outbreak has been identified. This might be a good opportunity to tell those suffering from Covid Derangement Syndrome, like MikeP, that the...

[Influenza] B/Yamagata lineage might have become extinct in 2020/2021 due to COVID-19 pandemic measures. In October 2023, the World Health Organization concluded that protection against the Yamagata lineage was no longer necessary in the seasonal flu vaccine, reducing the number of lineages targeted by the vaccine from four to three.

The pathogenesis matters. The intervention should be appropriately aligned to the specific details of the virus/host/disease. YMMV.

There is a weird worship of raw milk these days. Can't these people eat fruits and vegetables? Is that not enough?
